alert.note: Alert for Henderson; Transylvania (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 11:09AM EST until January 12 at 12:24PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina... French Broad River At Blantyre affecting Henderson and Transylvania Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...French Broad River at Blantyre. * WHEN...Until early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, The French Broad River may be overtopping the railroad tracks and floodwaters may begin inundating a trailer park on River Ridge Rd. Floodwaters may be approaching buildings north of Grove Bridge Road along US 64. Parts of River Road, Pleasant Grove Rd., Butler Bridge Rd. and Big Willow Rd. are likely flooding. Associated tributaries, including the Little River near Penrose, are likely experiencing significant flooding due to high water levels on the French Broad River. Significant flooding of farmland along the French Broad River is ongoing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 20.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:45 AM EST Wednesday was 23.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Friday morning and continue falling to 8.5 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.2 feet on 01/26/1978. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement will be issued this evening at 1115 PM EST.
